content.text:
# Draft:List of vice presidents of the United States by previous experience

----
The Vice President of the United States is the second-highest elected official in the federal government of the United States, after the President of the United States. The vice president's responsibilities include presiding over the United States Senate and casting tie-breaking votes when necessary. The vice president is also first in the presidential line of succession.
Background
In the early elections of the United States, electors cast two votes for president without distinguishing between presidential and vice presidential candidates. Under this system, the vice presidency was awarded to the presidential runner-up. This system created the potential for the president and vice president to come from different political factions, which could lead to administrative discord. The Twelfth Amendment was ratified to address this issue, establishing separate Electoral College votes for president and vice president.
